title: Are 3D printers used to make prototypes? - Quora

response.answer_text: The short answer to your question is yes: 3D printers are used to make prototypes, but prototyping is just one sector of what 3D printing is used for. As far as prototypes go, I’ve seen both conceptual prototypes and functional prototypes. Depending on what’s being done and why, end use parts are also something that can be made. Casting patterns (masters for RTV/similar mold making) are another common application similar to prototyping.
Yes, though normally the materials are not suited for a functional prototype, but instead the model is used to identify issues and refinements to be made before a functional prototype is machined.
